newsitem.title: CHINA: China's rents rise 14.6 pct in first half.
newsitem.headline: China's rents rise 14.6 pct in first half.

text.p: Rents in China's 36 main cities rose by 14.6 percent in the first half of the year compared with the same period in 1996, the China Business Times said on Monday.
Rents would continue to rise, by about 15 percent a year, it said, quoting the State Price Information Centre.
Prices of water for urban residents in the first half rose by 16.6 percent compared with the year-ago period, it said.
Electricity prices in 20 of the 38 cities rose by an average of 17.3 percent in January to June compared with the same period in 1996, it said.
Piped gas prices rose by 33.63 percent and natural gas prices increased by 8.76 percent in January to June compared with the year-ago period, it said.
China's consumer price inflation in the first half was 4.1 percent year-on-year.
